dt: {bc}a marriage ceremony usually with its accompanying festivities {bc}{sx|nuptials||}
{bc}an act, process, or instance of joining in close association

shortdef: a marriage ceremony usually with its accompanying festivities : nuptials
an act, process, or instance of joining in close association
a wedding anniversary or its celebration —usually used in combination

dt: {bc}to take for wife or husband by a formal ceremony {bc}{sx|marry||}
{bc}to unite as if by marriage: such as
{bc}to place in close or intimate association

dt.t: films that made me conscious of the power of {it}wedding{/it} image to music

et: Middle English {it}wedden{/it}, from Old English {it}weddian{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}wetten{/it} to pledge, Old English {it}wedd{/it} pledge, Old High German {it}wetti{/it}, Goth {it}wadi{/it}, Latin {it}vad-, vas{/it} bail, security
shortdef: to take for wife or husband by a formal ceremony : marry
to unite as if by marriage: such as

dt: {bc}a usually elaborately decorated and tiered cake made for the celebration of a wedding
{bc}something (such as a large building) resembling a wedding cake especially in elaborate ornamentation

shortdef: a usually elaborately decorated and tiered cake made for the celebration of a wedding
something (such as a large building) resembling a wedding cake especially in elaborate ornamentation

dt: {bc}a march of slow tempo and stately character that is composed or played to accompany the bridal procession

shortdef: a march of slow tempo and stately character that is composed or played to accompany the bridal procession

dt: {bc}a ring of metal (such as gold) given by the groom to the bride during the wedding service
{bc}a similar ring given by the bride to the groom in a double-ring service

shortdef: a ring of metal (such as gold) given by the groom to the bride during the wedding service; also : a similar ring given by the bride to the groom in a double-ring service
the bride, groom, and their attendants

dt: {bc}an event at which the people involved in a wedding ceremony practice what will be done at the ceremony

shortdef: an event at which the people involved in a wedding ceremony practice what will be done at the ceremony

dt: {bc}to think that two people will get married to each other soon

dt.t: The minute I saw your brother and my friend together, I {it}heard wedding bells{/it}.

shortdef: to think that two people will get married to each other soon

dt: {bc}a traditional wedding in which the bride wears a white dress

shortdef: a traditional wedding in which the bride wears a white dress
